description: Students in this course engage critically and intensively with the distinctive formal commitments, theoretical position and modus operandi of a leading practitioner or practice or visiting academic. Their example is used as a springboard for advancing new directions in which students can formulate and demonstrate a related but independent position responsive to their own time, place and culture. Studio activities are typically conducted in an intensive mode to enable significant national and international guests to lead the studio and may be held off campus.
restricted: MArch students only. Study Abroad students must seek Head of School permission to enrol. Summer Semester offering subject to Permission by Head of School.
